abstract: The Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, urged senators on Thursday not to strip the central bank of its authority to supervise the country’s largest banks, warning that to do so would pose a “grave risk.”

lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, urged senators on Thursday not to strip the central bank of its authority to supervise the country’s largest banks, warning that to do so would pose a “grave risk,” The New York Times’s Sewell Chan reports from Washington.

headline.main: Bernanke Defends Fed’s Ability to Supervise Banks
